[[Image:VMware Workstation 6 running ubuntu.png|260px|right|thumb|[[VMware Workstation]] running [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], on Windows, uses a ''Type-2 Hypervisor'' to allow [[Operating System]]s to run [[Virtualization|virtualized]].]]

[[Image:VMware Workstation.png|260px|right|thumb|[[VMware Workstation]] running [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]], on Windows, uses a ''Type-2 Hypervisor'' to allow [[Operating System]]s to run [[Virtualization|virtualized]].]]
In [[computing]], a '''hypervisor''' (also: '''virtual machine monitor''') is a [[Platform virtualization|virtualization]] platform that allows multiple [[operating system]]s to run on a host computer at the same time.
In [[computing]], a '''hypervisor''' (also: '''virtual machine monitor''') is a [[Platform virtualization|virtualization]] platform that allows multiple [[operating system]]s to run on a host computer at the same time.
